questions.question_text:
You are setting up the yearly budget for an organization for the year 2019.
You need to set up the budget register entries.
Which two fields must be set up when creating register entries? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
The question requires to identify type of entries allowed which is either expenses or Revenue. And these can't be allowed without account structure.

comments.content:
Budget register entry lines must select only one account structure.
The budget register entries can contain either Expense or Revenue amount types.

discussion.content:
B isnt Correct/
Main account not need to be specified/....rather but the structutre

comments.content: an amount of zero is allowed which means that answer B isn't correct

The Budget register entries defaulting of amount type feature allows the default amount type within a budget register entry to be an amount type other than expense. The budget register entry line now will default to expense when the main account type is expense; will default to revenue when the main account type is expense; and will default to expense for all other account types.
